intro: Eurycentrum amblyoceras, commonly known as the narrow-capsuled eurycentrum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in composite inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
